info.name: Werewolf
info.description: A humanoid cursed with lycanthropy; able to shift between human, wolf, or hybrid form, gaining heightened senses, natural attacks, and regeneration.
info.author: Fawkes

description.p: Werewolves are humans cursed to become beasts under the moon, blending strength and ferocity with human cunning and resilience.
Shapechanger. As an action, you can transform into wolf or hybrid form. Your equipment does not transform and your statistics, except armor class, remain the same.
Regeneration. You regenerate some hit points each round unless you are at 0 hit points.
Natural Attacks. In wolf or hybrid form you have bite (1d8) and claw (1d6) attacks.
Heightened Senses. You have advantage on Perception checks relying on hearing or smell.
Darkvision. You can see in dim light within 60 feet as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light.
You can transform into wolf or hybrid form. Only your AC changes in those forms; equipment remains unaffected.
You regain 1 hit point at the start of your turn if you are not at 0 hit points.
You have special attacks: a bite dealing 1d8 damage, and claws dealing 1d6 damage when in wolf or hybrid form.
You have advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing or smell.
You can see in dim light within 60 feet as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light.
